intro: Ammoselinum, commonly known as the sand sedge, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. These plants typically grow in sandy or coastal environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Ammoselinum species are often found in dunes and other unstable soils, where they help stabilize the environment. Their ecological importance lies in their role in preventing erosion and supporting local biodiversity.
